PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - THE PURPOSE OF THE LIGHTHOUSE PROJECT SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM IS TO PROVIDE FINANCIAL SUPPORT IN THE FORM OF TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS TO INDIVIDUALS PURSUING GRADUATE TRAINING IN PUBLIC HEALTH.  THE FOCUS OF THE TRAINING WILL BE TO INCREASE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS REQUIRED TO RESPOND TO COVID-19, OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES AND LEAD EFFORTS TOWARD RESILIENCE AND RECOVERY FROM SUCH EVENTS.     NEED:  THIS NEWLY TRAINED PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE WILL BE EMPLOYED IN THE COMMUNITIES OF GREATEST NEED AND WILL BE RACIALLY/ETHNICALLY SIMILAR TO THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE.  ALIGNING TRAINING WITH COMMUNITY AND HEALTH DEPARTMENT NEEDS IN DETROIT AND MICHIGAN CAN BETTER FORTIFY PUBLIC HEALTH RESPONSE. THE LPSP WILL ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING 4 BROAD OBJECTIVES:   1) ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY ENHANCING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND PROMOTING LINKAGES TO IDENTIFY EMPLOYMENT NEEDS;  2) ENSURE OUR CURRENT WAYNE STATE UNIVERSITY (WSU) MASTER OF PUBLIC HEALTH (MPH) PROGRAM TRAINING PROGRAM ALIGNS WITH PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE NEEDS;  3) EDUCATE THE WORKFORCE TO ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INTEGRATE PRINCIPLES OF SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH INTO PUBLIC HEALTH PRACTICE; AND  4) PROVIDE SPECIFIC HANDS-ON TRAINING IN RESPONDING TO COVID-19 AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGING ISSUES.   TO MEET OUR OBJECTIVES, WE WILL LEVERAGE AND DIVERSIFY OUR CURRENT COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS BY OFFERING MPH PROGRAM TUITION-BASED SCHOLARSHIPS FOR URM AND DISADVANTAGED PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE EMPLOYEES, HEALTH PROFESSIONAL STUDENTS AND UNDERGRADUATES. TOGETHER, THESE STUDENTS WILL BRING THEIR OWN BACKGROUNDS AND TRAINING EXPERIENCES TO INTERPROFESSIONAL COLLABORATIONS THAT WILL PROVIDE THE MAINSTAY FOR THE FUTURE OF THE METROPOLITAN DETROIT PUBLIC HEALTH COMMUNITY.  THE TOTAL NUMBER OF PROJECTED SCHOLARSHIPS FOR THE ENTIRE FUNDING PERIOD = 30. METHODOLOGY: THE LPSP TEAM INCLUDES A COMBINATION OF PUBLIC HEALTH TRAINING PROGRAM FACULTY, EDUCATION SPECIALIS TS, PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENTS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS WHO WILL COLLABORATE TO TRAIN GRADUATE PUBLIC HEALTH STUDENTS TO RESPOND TO PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES. THIS PROJECT WILL HAVE ACTIVE INVOLVEMENT FROM DETROIT-BASED PUBLIC HEALTH EXPERTS WHO WILL PROVIDE DIRECT TRAINING AND SKILL DEVELOPMENT TO THE STUDENTS.   CLASSROOM TRAINING IN A CULTURALLY RESPONSIVE ENVIRONMENT AND HANDS-ON FIELD EXPERIENCE IN RESPONDING AND RECOVERING TO PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGING THREATS IS DESIGNED TO BOLSTER THE ABILITY OF THE GRADUATES TO PROCURE EMPLOYMENT IN PUBLIC HEALTH SECTORS.  A VARIETY OF SKILLS ACQUISITION COMBINED WITH FOCUSED CAREER DEVELOPMENT IS INTENDED TO INCREASE AND DIVERSIFY THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE.   EVALUATION: OUR COMPREHENSIVE EVALUATION PLAN IS BASED ON THE HEALTHYPEOPLE2020 MAP-IT PROCESSES. CAREFUL DATA TRACKING OF COMPETENCY AND STUDENT SKILLS ATTAINMENT WILL BE ONGOING.  ADAPTING QUICKLY TO CHANGES IN PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE NEEDS WILL LEAD TO CHANGES IN TRAINING.  SURVEYS FOR ALL RECRUITMENT, RETENTION AND GRADUATION OF THE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS WILL INFORM BEST PRACTICES AND ENHANCE SUSTAINABILITY OF PROGRAM EFFORTS.  MEASURES OF STUDENT, FACULTY AND COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION TRAINING PERFORMANCE WILL ALSO BE CAPTURED.  LONG-TERM FOLLOW-UP STRATEGIES TO ASSESS ALUMNI JOB PERFORMANCE AND SKILLS APPLICATION WILL ALSO BE CONDUCTED.   BY SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENTING THIS FUNDED PROJECT WE WILL HAVE GRADUATED 30 URM OR DISADVANTAGED MPH PROGRAM STUDENTS, WHO WILL HAVE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS TO RESPOND TO ANY PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGING THREAT AND THEY WILL OBTAIN EMPLOYMENT TO INCREASE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE SERVING DETROIT AND THE SURROUNDING COMMUNITIES.   FUNDING PREFERENCE:  WE ARE APPLYING FOR A FUNDING PREFERENCE BASED ON OUR PERFORMANCE IN THE TWO FOLLOWING AREAS: (1) SERVING INDIVIDUALS FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS AND (2) LARGE PROPORTIONS OF INDIVIDUALS WHO SERVE IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - ADDRESS: 1845 N. SOTO STREET, LOS ANGELES, CA 90032-9239 PROJECT DIRECTOR NAME: AMIE HWANG CONTACT PHONE NUMBER: +1 323 865 0337 EMAIL ADDRESS: AMIEHWAN@USC.EDU  THIS PROPOSAL IS TO BUILD A PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT PROGRAM (WDP) THROUGH USC MASTER OF PUBLIC HEALTH (MPH) PROGRAM WITH A PURPOSE OF INCREASING THE CAPACITY OF PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEMS TO MEET CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS, THE TEN ESSENTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES AND DECREASE PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES. WE AIM TO TRAIN STUDENTS TO ATTAIN KNOWLEDGE AND COMPETENCIES THAT WILL ENABLE THEM TO SECURE POSITIONS IN PUBLIC HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS THAT ADDRESS HEALTH DISPARITIES AMONG RESIDENTS OF LOS ANGELES COUNTY AND SERVE THOSE AT THE GREATEST NEED FOR PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES AND HEALTH LITERACY. THESE PUBLIC HEALTH STUDENTS WILL RECEIVE TRAINING IN ORGANIZATIONS THAT SERVE THE UNDERSERVED RESIDENTS OF LA COUNTY AND EMPHASIZE INCREASING KNOWLEDGE AND COMPETENCIES ABOUT HEALTH DISPARITIES, INCLUDING HOW TO REDUCE THEM THROUGH PUBLIC ACTIONS SUCH AS POLICY, BUILDING INFRASTRUCTURE, PROMOTING HEALTH LITERACY, IMPROVING HEALTH COMMUNICATIONS, AND SUPPORTING THE CULTURE AND LANGUAGE OF ALL SUBPOPULATIONS. WE WILL ACCOMPLISH THIS AIM BY ACHIEVING 7 OBJECTIVES.    1. INCREASE THE NUMBER OF QUALIFIED MPH PROGRAM APPLICANTS FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS WHO ARE ELIGIBLE TO APPLY TO THE TRAINEESHIP PROGRAM BY 20%.   2. SELECT AND ENROLL 24 QUALIFIED MPH STUDENTS IN THE TRAINEESHIP PROGRAM OVER 3 YEARS.    3. PROVIDE AT LEAST FOUR ONE-ON-ONE ADVISEMENT AND MENTORSHIP SESSIONS TO TRAINEES PER ACADEMIC YEAR.  4. IMPLEMENT TRAINING THROUGH THE OFFERING OF MPH COURSEWORK (42 CREDITS OVER TWO YEARS) AND MAKE AVAILABLE ENROLLMENT IN A MINIMUM OF TWO SUPPLEMENTAL TRAINING WORKSHOPS PER YEAR THAT ADDRESS CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE SERVICES (CLAS), DEI, HEALTH DISPARITIES, AND OTHER PERTINENT PUBLIC HEALTH ISSUES.  5. BY THE END OF THEIR FIRST YEAR OF THE MPH PROGRAM, ALL TR AINEES WILL BEGIN A FIELD EXPERIENCE (PRACTICUM) IN GOVERNMENT, PUBLIC HEALTH-FOCUSED COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, OR PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATIONS AND WILL COMPLETE THE 3-MONTH PLACEMENT BY THE END OF THEIR 2-YEAR MPH DEGREE PROGRAM.  6. BY THE END OF THE TRAINEESHIP PROGRAM, TRAINEES WILL DEMONSTRATE READINESS FOR PUBLIC HEALTH CAREERS.   7. BY 6 MONTHS POST-TRAINING (UPON COMPLETION OF THE MPH DEGREE), 90% OF TRAINEES WILL OBTAIN A FULL-TIME PUBLIC HEALTH POSITION IN GOVERNMENT, A PUBLIC HEALTH-RELATED COMMUNITY ORGANIZATION, OR A PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONAL ORGANIZATION.   THE OBJECTIVES WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH CAREFULLY DESIGNED TRAINING PROGRAM WHERE WE WILL SELECT 24 HIGHLY COMPETENT TRAINEES FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS, PROVIDE MENTORSHIP THROUGH ONE-ON-ONE ADVISEMENT AND NETWORK OF PUBLIC HEALTH ADVISORY BOARDS, MAINTAIN RIGOROUS COURSE WORK TRAINING THROUGH THE USC MPH PROGRAM, IMPLEMENT ADDITIONAL TRAINING ON HEALTH DISPARITIES THROUGH WORKSHOPS AND WEBINARS, PLACE THE TRAINEES IN ONE OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS FOR PRACTICUM AND ASSIST IN TRANSITIONING INTO FULL TIME EMPLOYMENT IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH PARTNER ORGANIZATIONS. THE TRAINEES WILL BE WELL EQUIPPED TO CONTRIBUTE AND ADDRESS THE MUCH-NEEDED GAP IN CAPACITY OF PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEMS AND HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INEQUITIES.    WE REQUEST TO BE CONSIDERED FOR FUNDING PREFERENCE. WE HAVE MET THE TWO CRITERIA; OF 2020-2021 STUDENTS, 34.3% WERE EDUCATIONALLY DISADVANTAGED AND 40.8% WERE UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITY. OF 2020-2021 GRADUATES, 52.2% WERE PLACED IN PRACTICE SETTING LOCATED IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREA.

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - 1 UNIVERSITY BLVD.  BLUFFTON, SC 29909 DIANA REINDL, PHD, CHES 843-208-8316 DREINDL@USCB.EDU WWW.USCB.EDU  $1,500,000.00 AWARD TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTH CAROLINA BEAUFORT’S (USCB’S) PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM WITH A REQUEST FOR PREFERRED FUNDING IN RESPONSE TO THE HRSA-22-122 PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM CALL FOR PROPOSALS. MORE THAN 90% OF REQUESTED FUNDS ARE ALLOCATED TO FUTURE PUBLIC-HEALTH STUDENT SCHOLARSHIPS. USCB HAS INVESTED IN OUR PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAM TO TRAIN FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS SINCE 2014. IN 2021, THE PROGRAM HAD 110 STUDENTS, WITH 39% OF OUR 2020-2021 GRADUATING CLASS SELF-IDENTIFYING AS BEING FROM A MINORITY BACKGROUND. IN ADDITION, AT LEAST ONE IN THREE ALUMNI WORK IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS (MUAS) ONE-YEAR POST-GRADUATION.  USCB IS THE ONLY PUBLIC FOUR-YEAR UNIVERSITY IN THE LOWCOUNTRY REGION. WE KNOW USCB STUDENTS ARE 90% NATIVE SOUTH CAROLINIANS, WITH NEARLY 40% LIVING IN COMMUNITIES FROM OUR FIVE-COUNTY SURROUNDING REGION THAT ARE EDUCATIONALLY DISADVANTAGED AND MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED. THE REGION’S RECOGNITION AS A DESIGNATED HEALTH PROFESSIONAL SHORTAGE AREA (HSPA) IN MENTAL HEALTH AND PRIMARY CARE BECAUSE OF INCOME, RURAL GEOGRAPHY, OR HIGH NEED HELPS ILLUSTRATE THE SHORTAGE OF HEALTHCARE PROFESSIONALS WHO SERVE VULNERABLE POPULATIONS IN OUR AREA. THESE FACTORS CONTRIBUTE SIGNIFICANTLY TO THE STRESSORS IMPACTING THE HEALTH OF OUR COMMUNITY.   THE FINANCIAL BURDEN OF BECOMING A PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONAL IS A LIABILITY FOR OUR FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE. IN ADDITION, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS EXACERBATED THE NEED FOR AN INFRASTRUCTURE OF PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS. USCB’S PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM AIMS TO INCREASE ACCESS TO HIGHER EDUCATION TO TRAIN OUR FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN THE SOUTH CAROLINA LOWCOUNTRY BY DECREASING THE COST OF HIGHER EDUCATION AS PART OF A 13 STRATEGY APPROACH INCLUDING SIX TIERS OF SCHOLARSHIPS.   USCB’S PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM PROPOSES TO  AWARD UP TO 474 SCHOLARSHIPS ACROSS THREE YEARS. AN AVERAGE OF 158 SCHOLARSHIPS ARE DISTRIBUTED PER YEAR AND INCLUDE FULL-RIDE SCHOLARSHIPS, FULL TUITION + FEE SCHOLARSHIPS, 80% TUITION + FEE SCHOLARSHIPS, 60% TUITION + FEE SCHOLARSHIPS, SUMMER SCHOOL, AND BOOK SCHOLARSHIPS. THE NUMBER OF UNIQUE STUDENTS SERVED WILL BE 90 EACH YEAR, OR 270 PEOPLE ACROSS THREE YEARS.    USCB’S PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM INTENDS TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES.  1. OBJECTIVE 1: BY 2025, KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF 200 FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE PROFESSIONALS IN THE LOWCOUNTRY WILL BE ENHANCED AS EVIDENCED BY PROGRAM ENROLLMENT.  -	SUBOBJECTIVE 1.1: ANNUALLY THROUGH 2025, IDENTIFY EMPLOYMENT NEEDS RELATED TO PUBLIC HEALTH WITH LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS. -	SUBOBJECTIVE 1.2: ANNUALLY THROUGH 2025, FOUR LEADERSHIP SPEAKER’S BUREAU EVENTS FOR USCB’S PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIPS OCCUR. -	SUBOBJECTIVE 1.3: BY 2025, 10 EMPLOYMENT FACILITATIONS OCCUR DUE TO THE PROGRAM OR PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCES ONE-YEAR POST-GRADUATION PROGRAM.   2. OBJECTIVE 2: AWARD 1.35 MILLION DOLLARS IN SCHOLARSHIPS TO EDUCATE OUR FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY 2025. TRAINED STUDENTS ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES BY INCORPORATING PRINCIPLES OF SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH INTO PRACTICE THROUGH A BACHELOR’S DEGREE CURRICULUM IN PUBLIC HEALTH AT USCB.   3. OBJECTIVE 3: REALIZE A $300,000 RETURN ON INVESTMENT BY 2025 TO OUR COMMUNITY THROUGH THE PREVENTION, PREPARATION, AND RESPONSE TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO PUBLIC HEALTH BY PROVIDING PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCE OPPORTUNITIES.   DRAMATICALLY DECREASING THE COST BURDEN TO ACHIEVE A BACHELOR’S DEGREE IN PUBLIC HEALTH AT USCB WILL BENEFIT STUDENTS FOR MANY YEARS TO COME AND CHANGE THE TRAJECTORY OF THEIR LIVES. LIKEWISE, HRSA-22-122 FUNDING WILL INCREASE OUR REGION’S PUBLIC HEALTH CAPACITY TO MEET CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS, INCLUDING THE TEN ESSENTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES, AND DECREASE HEALTH INEQUITIES

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - THE UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY COLLEGE OF PUBLIC HEALTH (UKCPH) IS REQUESTING $1,484,555 AND FUNDING PREFERENCE BASED ON QUALIFICATIONS IN THE AREAS OF (1) ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS AND (2) GRADUATING LARGE PROPORTIONS OF INDIVIDUALS WHO SERVE IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. BOTH SUBRECIPIENTS ALSO MEET THIS CRITERION WITH DOCUMENTATION INCLUDED IN ATTACHMENT 12. AS PER FUNDING REQUIREMENTS, OUR EXISTING HAZARD MITIGATION PLAN ENSURES THE CONTINUATION OF PROGRAMMATIC AND TRAINING ACTIVITIES IN THE EVENT OF AN EXPECTED AND UNEXPECTED PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY. KENTUCKY LEADS THE NATION IN MANY COMMON AND PREVENTABLE CAUSES OF DEATH AND HEALTH BEHAVIORS CONTRIBUTING TO DISEASE. ACCORDING TO THE UNITED HEALTH FOUNDATION'S (2021) AMERICA'S HEALTH RANKINGS, KENTUCKY RANKS 47TH IN THE NATION OVERALL IN HEALTH OUTCOMES, FURTHER SIGNIFYING THE NEED FOR A COMPETENT AND DIVERSE WORKFORCE. KENTUCKY IS INVESTING IN ITS WORKFORCE TO ENSURE THAT CURRENT AND FUTURE STAFF HAVE THE SKILLS AND KNOWLEDGE NECESSARY TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO ACTIVITIES RELATED TO CORONAVIRUS DISEASE 2019 (COVID-19) AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES. A MAJOR FOCAL AREA WILL ALSO BE TARGETING SKILLS RELATED TO SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH) THAT CONTRIBUTE TO POOR HEALTH OUTCOMES IN MANY KENTUCKY COMMUNITIES. THESE UPSTREAM FACTORS, SUCH AS EXTREME POVERTY, ENVIRONMENTAL RACISM, AND ADVERSE CHILDHOOD EXPERIENCES PRESENT UNIQUE CHALLENGES FOR THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE AND WERE EVIDENT DURING THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC. THE PANDEMIC TAUGHT US MANY LESSONS, AND THE UNIVERSITY OF KENTUCKY COLLEGE OF PUBLIC HEALTH IS EAGER TO COLLABORATE WITH THE CURRENT AND FUTURE WORKFORCE THROUGH THIS PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM (PHSP) TO TACKLE THESE CHALLENGES HEAD-ON AND CREATE MORE PUBLIC HEALTH CHAMPIONS. THROUGH THIS PROPOSED PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM FUNDING OPPORTUNITY, UKCPH WILL SERVE AS THE PROJECT APPLICANT AND PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR AND WILL COL LABORATE WITH TWO SUBRECIPIENT HIGHER EDUCATION, ACCREDITED PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS, EASTERN KENTUCKY UNIVERSITY (EKU) AND THE UNIVERSITY OF LOUISVILLE (UOFL) TO PROMOTE EXISTING PROGRAMS TO ELIGIBLE SCHOLARSHIP TRAINEES. EACH INSTITUTION SERVES A DIFFERENT GEOGRAPHIC AREA WITHIN THE STATE AND PROVIDES A WIDE VARIETY OF PUBLIC HEALTH EXPERTISE AND DEGREE PROGRAMS FOR A DIVERSE POPULATION. THE PROJECTED NUMBER OF TRAINEES IS 59, 88, AND 88 SCHOLARSHIPS IN YEARS 1-3, RESPECTIVELY, FOR A TOTAL OF 235 DURING THE ENTIRE PROJECT PERIOD. EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS WITH THE KENTUCKY DEPARTMENT FOR PUBLIC HEALTH, KENTUCKY HEALTH DEPARTMENTS ASSOCIATION, KENTUCKY PUBLIC HEALTH ASSOCIATION, AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM PARTNERS WILL BE STRENGTHENED TO CREATE A PIPELINE FOR PUBLIC HEALTH STUDENTS. THE PROPOSED PROJECT'S APPROACH IS TARGETED TO BOTH EXISTING STUDENTS LOOKING TO ENTER THE WORKFORCE, AS WELL AS THOSE CURRENTLY IN THE WORKFORCE LOOKING TO FURTHER THEIR SKILLS AND INCREASE CAPACITY: 1.	BY SEPTEMBER 30, 2025, ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY DEVELOPING OR STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND LINKAGES TO IDENTIFY EMPLOYMENT NEEDS, AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES, AND TO FACILITATE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS' EMPLOYMENT POST-TRAINING COMPLETION IN STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, INCLUDING STATE, LOCAL, TERRITORIAL, OR TRIBAL PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH-RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. 2.	BY SEPTEMBER 30, 2025, EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INCORPORATE PRINCIPLES OF SDOH INTO PRACTICE. 3.	BY SEPTEMBER 30, 2025, EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID-19, AS WELL AS OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES, BY PROVIDING PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCE (PRACTICA) OPPORTUNITIES.

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - ADDRESS: UIC SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH, 1603 W TAYLOR ST, CHICAGO, IL 60612 PROJECT DIRECTOR: NADINE PEACOCK PHONE: 312-355-1760, EMAIL: NPEACOCK@UIC.EDU, WEBSITE: HTTPS://PUBLICHEALTH.UIC.EDU/ FUNDS REQUESTED: $1,500,000 	THIS GRANT APPLICATION IS FOR THE PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM (PHSP) AT THE UNIVERSITY OF ILLINOIS CHICAGO (UIC) SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH (SPH). UIC SPH IS THE ONLY ACCREDITED SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH IN ILLINOIS. THE UIC SPH PHSP WILL PROVIDE MASTERS OF PUBLIC HEALTH (MPH) TRAINING FOR 57 IN-STATE UNDERREPRESENTED MINORITY (URM) TRAINEES OVER THE 3-YEAR PERIOD (YEAR 1: 31; YEAR 2: 36 TRAINEES, INCLUDING 25 CONTINUING AND 11 NEW; YEAR 3: 36 TRAINEES, INCLUDING 21 CONTINUING AND 15 NEW). TO QUALIFY, THE TRAINEES MUST BE URMS DEMONSTRATING FINANCIAL NEED, FROM MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS (MUAS) AND/OR MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES IN THE STATE, AND WITH A STATED COMMITMENT TO PURSUING A PUBLIC HEALTH CAREER IN THEIR COMMUNITY. WE ARE REQUESTING A FUNDING PREFERENCE BASED ON: (1) SERVING A LARGE PROPORTION (34.3%) OF URM MPH TRAINEES AND (2) OVER 34.7% OF OUR MPH GRADUATES WORK IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. 	THE PROGRAM WILL LEVERAGE OUR EXISTING MPH PROGRAM AND WILL INCLUDE: (1) THE SPH STUDENT SUCCESS PROGRAM WHICH PROVIDES FOUNDATIONAL WRITING AND QUANTITATIVE TRAINING (2) THE SCHOOL-WIDE MPH INTEGRATED CORE CURRICULUM WHICH IS MAPPED TO THE CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS AND THE 10 ESSENTIAL SERVICES; (3) THE CURRICULUM FOR ONE OF 5 CONCENTRATIONS (BIOSTATISTICS, COMMUNITY HEALTH SCIENCES, ENVIRONMENTAL AND OCCUPATIONAL HEALTH, EPIDEMIOLOGY, OR HEALTH POLICY AND ADMINISTRATION); (4) A PUBLIC HEALTH LEADERSHIP AND WORKFORCE PREPAREDNESS COURSE OR PROGRAM; AND (5) ELECTIVES CHOSEN FROM ONE OF FOUR UIC SPH PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE PREPAREDNESS CERTIFICATE PROGRAMS (I.E., HEALTH DISPARITIES RESEARCH, EMERGENCY PLANNING AND RESILIENCE, PUBLIC HEALTH GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS, OR PUBLIC HEALTH INFORMATICS). ADDITIONALLY, ALL TRAINEES WILL: (1) COMPLETE AN APPLIED PRACTICE EXPERIENCE (PRACTICUM) FOR ATLEAST192 HOURS (MINIMUM 3 MONTHS) AT AN IN-STATE GOVERNMENTAL OR NONPROFIT PUBLIC HEALTH ORGANIZATION THAT SERVES MUAS/MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES; AND (2) AN INTEGRATIVE CAPSTONE PROJECT RELATED TO THEIR CONCENTRATION AND FOCUSED ON MUAS/MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES. 	THE UIC SPH PHSP PROGRAM DIRECTLY RESPONDS TO LONG-STANDING STRUCTURAL AND SYSTEMIC INEQUITIES IN THE STATE AND DOCUMENTED NEED FOR A TRAINED PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE THAT HAS RELEVANT LIVED EXPERIENCES. TO THIS END, WE HAVE 7 OVERARCHING OBJECTIVES: (1) TO ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BASED UPON INPUT FROM OUR GOVERNMENTAL AND NONPROFIT PUBLIC HEALTH PARTNERS IN THE STATE; (2) TRAINEES WILL DEMONSTRATE COMPETENCE IN THE CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS AND THE 10 ESSENTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES AND WILL BE TRAINED TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO PANDEMICS OR OTHER EMERGENCIES; (3) TO PROVIDE TRAINEES WITH LEADERSHIP AND WORKFORCE PREPAREDNESS TRAINING; (4) EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO ADDRESS HEALTH INEQUITIES AND THE SDOH AND TO RESPOND TO PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES; (5) TO CONDUCT A PROGRAM EVALUATION OF THE INITIATIVE; (6) TO CONDUCT AN OUTCOME EVALUATION OF THE INITIATIVE, AND (7) TO DISSEMINATE METHODS AND FINDINGS.  	THE PHSP WILL BE DIRECTED AND IMPLEMENTED BY A TEAM WITH DEMONSTRATED EXPERIENCE WITH SIMILAR PROGRAMS. THE DIRECTOR (ASSOCIATE DEAN FOR DIVERSITY, EQUITY, AND INCLUSION) HAS A LONG HISTORY OF LEADING TRAINING AND LEADERSHIP PROGRAMS FOR MINORITY STUDENTS. THE CO-DIRECTOR (ASSISTANT DEAN FOR STUDENT AFFAIRS) OVERSEES SCHOOLWIDE RECRUITMENT, ADMISSIONS, AND RETENTION. THEY WILL BE SUPPORTED BY A PROJECT COORDINATOR AND EXISTING DEAN’S OFFICE STAFF. AN ADVISORY COMMITTEE WILL PROVIDE GUIDANCE TO THE PROJECT DIRECTORS AND THE SCHOOL’S EXISTING PARTNER ADVISORY BOARD WILL PROVIDE INPUT ON TRAINING AND WORKFORCE PREPAREDNESS NEEDS AS WELL AS PROVIDE SITES FOR STUDE

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - ABSTRACT  PROJECT TITLE: UCLA FIELDING SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH PUBLIC HEALTH (FSPH) SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM (PHSP) APPLICANT ORGANIZATION NAME: UCLA FIELDING SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH ADDRESS: UCLA FSPH BOX 951772, 16-035 CHS, LOS ANGELES, CA 90095-1772 CONTACT PRINCIPAL INVESTIGATOR: YIFANG ZHU, PHD       CONTACT PHONE NUMBERS: (310) 825-4324 (VOICE); (310) 749-2106 (FAX) EMAIL ADDRESS: YIFANG@UCLA.EDU WEBSITE ADDRESS: HTTP://PH.UCLA.EDU/    OVER THE PAST FEW YEARS, WE HAVE WITNESSED AN INCREASING DEMAND FOR PROFESSIONAL EDUCATION IN PUBLIC HEALTH AS MEASURED BY OUR LARGER APPLICANT POOL, AS WELL AS THROUGH SURVEYS WE HAVE CONDUCTED WITH UNDERGRADUATES. IN ADDITION TO INCREASING DEMAND, HEALTH WORKFORCE NEEDS ASSESSMENTS DEMONSTRATES THAT THE UNITED STATES IS FACING A SHORTFALL OF 250,000 PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS, WITH DIRE NEED IN AREAS IDENTIFIED AS MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED. TO ALLEVIATE THIS SHORTAGE, THE UCLA FSPH IS REQUESTING FUNDS TO INCREASE THE WORKFORCE OF PREPARED PROFESSIONALS WITH MASTER’S DEGREES IN PUBLIC HEALTH (MPH) AND HEALTH ADMINISTRATION (MHA). SPECIFIC OBJECTIVES INCLUDE: 1) RECRUIT AND SELECT 74 (32/YEAR IN YEAR 1 AND 21/YEAR IN YEARS 2-3) TO COMPLETE THE FSPH PHSP PROGRAM THROUGH TWO TRACKS, TRACK ONE: TRADITIONAL MPH AND TRACK TWO: EXECUTIVE MPH AND ON-LINE MHA. ANNUALLY, STUDENTS FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS WILL ENROLL IN FSPH TRADITIONAL MPH PROGRAMS UNDER TRACK ONE AND STUDENTS CURRENTLY WORKING IN PUBLIC HEALTH ENROLLED IN FSPH EXECUTIVE-STYLE MPH AND ONLINE MHA PROGRAMS DESIGNED FOR WORKING PROFESSIONALS WILL RECEIVE FULL-TUITION SCHOLARSHIPS TO COVER THE COST OF ATTENDANCE; 2) PROVIDE ALL SCHOLARS WITH ACADEMIC GRADUATE LEVEL COURSES LEADING TO THE MPH OR MHA DEGREE; 3) PROVIDE ALL SCHOLARS WITH SUPPORT SERVICES INCLUDING CAREER AND PEER MENTORING, ACADEMIC SUPPORTS, AND SOCIAL-EMOTIONAL SUPPORTS; 4) AS NEEDED, IDENTIFY 10 POTENTIAL COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS, OUTSIDE OF THE ESTABLISHED LOCAL GOVERNMENT AND COMMUN ITY ORGANIZATION PARTNERS, IN BOTH URBAN AND RURAL MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS (MUAS), TO SERVE AS PRACTICE-BASED FIELD PLACEMENT SITES AND EMPLOYMENT AND EMPLOYEE RECRUITMENT PARTNERS; 4) SUPERVISE AND MONITOR EACH SCHOLARS PROGRESS IN THEIR PROGRAMS; 6) PROVIDE CAREER PLACEMENT ASSISTANCE FOR ALL SCHOLARS AS NEEDED, AND 7) TRACK SCHOLARS’ EMPLOYMENT POST-GRADUATION. FSPH IS WELL SUITED TO LEAD THIS PROGRAM AND QUALIFIES FOR FUNDING PREFERENCE AND MEET BOTH FUNDING PREFERENCE #1 AND #2, AS DEFINED BY HRSA.   THE UCLA FSPH IS CONSISTENTLY RANKED IN THE TOP 15 SCHOOLS OF PUBLIC HEALTH IN THE US AND IS INTERNATIONALLY RECOGNIZED FOR ITS CONTRIBUTIONS TO PUBLIC HEALTH RESEARCH AND PRACTICE AND ITS COMMITMENT TO ELIMINATING HEALTH DISPARITIES THROUGH PARTNERSHIPS WITH LOCAL ORGANIZATIONS AND TRAINING STUDENTS WITHIN THE COMMUNITIES THAT THEY SERVE. OUR STUDENTS CONDUCT INTERNSHIPS AND/OR GO ON TO PURSUE CAREERS IN LOCAL COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS IN MUAS ACROSS CALIFORNIA, AS WELL AS POSITIONS AT STATE AND LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENTS. AS A RESULT, WE ARE UNIQUELY POSITIONED TO BOTH RECRUIT STUDENTS FROM A BROAD RANGE OF ETHNIC, CULTURAL AND SOCIO-DEMOGRAPHIC BACKGROUNDS AND TO TRAIN PROFESSIONALS IN PUBLIC HEALTH PRACTICE TO SERVE IN MUAS, AS WELL AS WORKFORCE SHORTAGE AREAS. BUILDING UPON EXISTING INFRASTRUCTURE OF THE FSPH, AS WELL AS OUR EXPANSIVE NETWORK OF PARTNERS AT THE LOCAL AND STATE LEVELS, THIS TRAINING PROGRAM WILL AIM AT: (1) IMPROVING AND STRENGTHENING THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY FACILITATING THE ENTRY OF INDIVIDUALS FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS INTO PUBLIC HEALTH CAREERS; (2) INCREASE THE NUMBER OF HEALTH CARE PROFESSIONALS WHO WORK IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ACROSS CALIFORNIA. WITH THIS SUPPORT WE WILL BOLSTER THE EDUCATION, TRAINING AND FIELD WORK OF 74 MPH AND MHA STUDENTS. THIS ASSISTANCE IS CRITICAL TO RECRUIT AND RETAIN STUDENTS FROM COMMUNITIES OF NEED WHO THEN AS HEALTH PROFESSIONALS SUPPORT THE HEALTH AND WELL-BEING OF COMMUN

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS EXPOSED A WEAK AND LAGGING PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN THE UNITED STATES. IN ADDRESSING EXISTING HEALTH DISPARITIES AND PREPARING FOR THE NEXT PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY, IT WILL BE IMPORTANT TO HAVE A WELL-TRAINED AND EXPERIENCED PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE. OUR GOAL IS TO BUILD PHYSICIAN LEADERS IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE CAPABLE OF EXECUTING THE CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS AND THE TEN ESSENTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES USING A PREVENTION AND SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH FRAMEWORK IN VARIED PUBLIC HEALTH-RELATED SETTINGS. OBJECTIVE 1: TO ENHANCE AND STRENGTHEN THE EXISTING RELATIONSHIPS THAT UCLA PREVENTIVE MEDICINE FELLOWSHIP PROGRAM HAS WITH 1) LOS ANGELES COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF PUBLIC HEALTH, 2) LOS ANGELES COUNTY DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH SERVICES, 3) SOUTHERN CALIFORNIA ADDICTION MEDICINE CONSORTIUM AND PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO ALLOW 6 PHYSICIAN TRAINEES EACH YEAR A) TO EXERCISE THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND HONE THEIR SKILLS RELATED TO THE CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS AND TEN ESSENTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES IN VARIED PUBLIC HEALTH SETTINGS, B) TO SIGNIFICANTLY ENGAGE IN PREVENTION AND RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID-19 AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES, C) TO ACTIVELY EXPLORE PUBLIC HEALTH EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN VARIED SETTINGS. OBJECTIVE 2: TO DEVELOP THE COMPETENCY OF PHYSICIANS AT VARIOUS LEVELS OF TRAINING (MEDICAL STUDENTS, RESIDENTS, FELLOWS) IN IMPLEMENTING CONCEPTS OF PREVENTION AND SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH TO IMPROVE PUBLIC HEALTH BY OFFERING WORKSHOPS AND/OR FIELD EXPERIENCES TO AT LEAST 50 PHYSICIAN TRAINEES EACH YEAR. OBJECTIVE 3: TO STRENGTHEN PHYSICIAN TRAINEES' INVOLVEMENT IN PUBLIC HEALTH PREPAREDNESS AND RECOVERY ACTIVITIES THROUGH COMMUNITY-BASED PARTNERSHIPS, BY OFFERING WORKSHOPS AND/OR FIELD EXPERIENCES TO AT LEAST 10 PHYSICIAN TRAINEES EACH YEAR. WE PROPOSE TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIP FUNDING TO SIX PHYSICIANS ACCEPTED INTO THE UCLA PREVENTIVE MEDICINE PROGRAM TO PURSUE THEIR MASTER DEGREES IN PUBLIC HEALTH IN HEALTH POLICY AND MANAGEMENT TRACK. WE AIM TO RETAIN PHYSICIANS IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY OFFERING THEM AT LEAST THREE MONTHS OF PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCES IN VARIED SETTINGS, HELPING THEM DEVELOP SCHOLARLY PRODUCTS, ENCOURAGING NATIONAL PUBLIC HEALTH CONFERENCE ATTENDANCE AND EXPOSING THEM TO VARIOUS JOB OPPORTUNITIES IN PUBLIC HEALTH. WE WILL SET UP AN EVALUATION PROCESS TO UNDERSTAND THE HEALTH DISPARITIES OF THE POPULATION SERVED, THE CULTURAL AND LINGUISTIC NEEDS OF THE POPULATION SERVED, THE EDUCATIONAL NEEDS OF THE TRAINEES, THE QUALITY OF THE ROTATION EXPERIENCES OFFERED AND TO CONTINUOUSLY IMPROVE THE TRAINING EXPERIENCES OFFERED. WE ARE REQUESTING FOR THE FUNDING PREFERENCE OF THIS OPPORTUNITY BASED ON US TRAINING AT LEAST 20% OF OUR TRAINEES FROM EDUCATIONALLY DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS AND GRADUATING 50% TRAINEES WHO WORK IN UNDER-SERVED SETTINGS.

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - THE PROPOSED PROJECT WILL PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS FOR GRADUATE TRAINING IN PUBLIC HEALTH AT THE INDIANA UNIVERSITY SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH BLOOMINGTON TO BOLSTER THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN INDIANA. THERE WILL BE EMPHASIS ON RECRUITING TRAINEES FROM UNDERREPRESENTED BACKGROUNDS AND PROVIDING FIELD EXPERIENCE AND POST-GRADUATE EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES IN AREAS LOCATED IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN INDIANA. WE HAVE DEMONSTRATED SUCCESS IN THESE PRIORITY AREAS (SEE DATA IN ATTACHMENT 12), AND WE THEREFORE REQUEST A FUNDING PREFERENCE.  THE PROJECT WILL ACCOMPLISH 3 OBJECTIVES:  (1) ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN INDIANA BY DEVELOPING OR STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND LINKAGES TO IDENTIFY EMPLOYMENT NEEDS, TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES, AND TO FACILITATE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS’ EMPLOYMENT POST-TRAINING COMPLETION IN STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, INCLUDING THE INDIANA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH OR LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH-RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. THIS OBJECTIVE WILL BE MET BY FACILITATING THE EMPLOYMENT OF 80% OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS IN PUBLIC HEALTH POSITIONS IN INDIANA IN EACH OF THE THREE YEARS OF THE PROJECT. WE WILL STRENGTHEN EXISTING PARTNERSHIPS AND DEVELOP NEW PARTNERSHIPS THROUGHOUT THE STATE TO CREATE EMPLOYMENT PIPELINES THAT ADDRESS THE WORKFORCE AND PUBLIC HEALTH NEEDS OF INDIANA, WITH A PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON UNDERSERVED AREAS OF THE STATE.  (2) EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN INDIANA TO ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INCORPORATE PRINCIPLES OF SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH) INTO PRACTICE. THIS OBJECTIVE WILL BE MET BY RECRUITING 32 SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS TO COMPLETE THE ONLINE PUBLIC HEALTH GRADUATE CERTIFICATE IN YEAR ONE, RECRUITING 32 SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS TO COMPLETE THE MPH DEGREE IN YEAR TWO, AND RECRUITING 32 SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS TO COMPLETE THE MPH DEGREE IN YEAR THREE. WE WILL RECRUIT TRAINEES TO COMPLETE OUR EXISTING ON LINE GRADUATE CERTIFICATE IN PUBLIC HEALTH AND/OR ONE OF OUR EXISTING MASTER OF PUBLIC HEALTH DEGREE PROGRAMS. OUR CURRICULUM WILL FOCUS ON ADDRESSING HEALTH DISPARITIES AND THE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH.  (3) EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN INDIANA TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID–19, AS WELL AS OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES, BY PROVIDING PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCE (PRACTICUM) OPPORTUNITIES. THIS OBJECTIVE WILL BE MET BY PLACING 14 GRADUATE PUBLIC HEALTH STUDENTS IN PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCE SITES IN INDIANA DURING EACH OF THE THREE YEARS OF THE PROGRAM. WE WILL RELY ON STRONG EXISTING COMMUNITY-BASED PARTNERS AND DEVELOP NEW PARTNERSHIPS TO UTILIZE AS FIELD EXPERIENCE LOCATIONS FOR TRAINEES TO GAIN EXPERIENCE ADDRESSING PUBLIC HEALTH NEEDS IN UNDERSERVED AREAS OF INDIANA.

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - THE COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER EMERGENCY RESPONSE AND PREPAREDNESS (CHW-ERP) PROJECT WILL STRENGTHEN AND DIVERSIFY THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO BETTER MEET THE NEEDS OF UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES IN THE MINNEAPOLIS - ST. PAUL METROPOLITAN AREA BY 1) ENGAGING COMMUNITY/EMPLOYER PARTNERS TO BUILD COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER CERTIFICATE AND BACCALAUREATE PROGRAM RECRUITMENT, TRAINING, AND JOB PLACEMENT PIPELINES; 2) EDUCATING TRAINEES TO ADDRESS SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH IN CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE AND ACCESSIBLE WAYS; AND 3) PREPARING TRAINEES TO RESPOND TO COVID-19 AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES THROUGH CURRICULUM, PRACTICUM, AND SIMULATION EXPERIENCES. LED BY ST. CATHERINE UNIVERSITY'S (ST. KATE'S) DIRECTOR OF PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS, THE PROJECT WILL RESULT IN 4-5 PIPELINE PARTNERSHIP MOUS; AN INTEGRATED COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE CURRICULUM WITH CORRESPONDING PRACTICUM EXPERIENCES AVAILABLE THROUGH 14 DIFFERENT SITES; THE DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF AN EMERGENCY RESPONSE SIMULATION EXERCISES; WITHIN A CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY VALIDATED CURRICULUM. THE PROJECT WILL RECRUIT 118 CHW TRAINEES, WHO WILL RECEIVE CAREER DEVELOPMENT AND WRAP-AROUND SUPPORTS AT ST. KATE'S; AT LEAST 70% OF PROGRAM GRADUATES WILL JOIN THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN TARGETED UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES. SPECIFICALLY, IN YEAR 1, 48 TRAINEES WILL RECEIVE SCHOLARSHIPS; 40 WILL IN YEAR 2; AND 30 WILL IN YEAR 3. MANY OF THE STUDENTS WHO ATTEND ST. KATE’S COMMUNITY HEALTH WORKER (CHW) CERTIFICATE PROGRAM AND ITS PUBLIC HEALTH BACCALAUREATE PROGRAMS HAIL FROM THESE COMMUNITIES IN MINNEAPOLIS AND ST. PAUL, AND AS A RESULT, THE UNIVERSITY MEETS THE CRITERIA FOR SERVING INDIVIDUALS FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS: IN ACADEMIC YEAR 2020-2021, 40% OF PUBLIC HEALTH STUDENTS WERE EDUCATIONALLY/ENVIRONMENTALLY DISADVANTAGED; 27% (OF THOSE FOR WHOM THERE IS FINANCIAL DATA) WERE ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED; AND 25% WERE UNDERREPRESE NTED RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITIES (A FIGURE THAT RISES TO 50% IF HMONG AND OTHER DISADVANTAGED SOUTHEAST ASIAN GROUPS WERE INCLUDED). FURTHER, SIGNIFICANT NUMBERS OF PUBLIC HEALTH STUDENTS GO ON TO WORK IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES ONCE THEY GRADUATE. AS SUCH, ST. KATE’S QUALIFIES FOR THE TWO FUNDING PREFERENCES ASSOCIATED WITH THIS PROGRAM: 1) SERVING INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS, INCLUDING UNDERREPRESENTED RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITIES, AND 2) GRADUATING LARGE PROPORTIONS OF INDIVIDUALS WHO SERVE IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

SACRED HEART UNIVERSITY (SHU), A PRIVATE, COEDUCATIONAL UNIVERSITY LOCATED IN SUBURBAN FAIRFIELD, CONNECTICUT, REQUESTS A HRSA PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM (PHSP) GRANT TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE REGIONAL PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM TO MEET CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS, THE TEN ESSENTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES, AND DECREASE PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES. THE OVERALL GOAL OF THE PIONEERS OF PUBLIC HEALTH (POPH) PROJECT CORRESPONDS DIRECTLY WITH HRSA’S OVERARCHING GOAL OF THE PHSP GRANT PROGRAM. SHU HAS ESTABLISHED THE FOLLOWING OBJECTIVES TO REACH THIS GOAL DURING THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD: 1) ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY RECRUITING 24 BACHELOR’S-TRAINED PUBLIC HEALTH WORKERS TO ENROLL IN AND COMPLETE THE SHU MPH PROGRAM. 2) FORMALIZE NEW, AND STRENGTHEN EXISTING, LINKAGES WITH STATE, REGIONAL, AND LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH ENTITIES (INCLUDING STATE AND LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENTS AND NON-PROFITS) FOR BI-DIRECTIONAL KNOWLEDGE AND SKILL DEVELOPMENT BY PROVIDING 31 FIELD PLACEMENTS AND VARIOUS COURSE-BASED IMMERSIVE TRAINING EXPERIENCES LEADING TO POST-COMPLETION EMPLOYMENT.  3) TRAIN THE FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN THE PRINCIPLES AND CHALLENGES OF PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES THROUGH UNDERGRADUATE AND GRADUATE TRAINING RELATED TO HEALTH EQUITY, SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH, AND CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE HEALTH COMMUNICATION AS DEMONSTRATED BY A T LEAST 80% OF MPH AND 85% OF BS STUDENTS ACHIEVING COMPETENCY IN HEALTH COMMUNICATION ON COURSE-BASED ASSESSMENTS. 4) ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES BY ESTABLISHING A PATHWAY PROGRAM FOR UNDERGRADUATE HEALTH SCIENCE STUDENTS FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS TO ENGAGE IN A COMPREHENSIVE PUBLIC HEALTH TRAINING PROGRAM (BS-MPH) WITH SUPPORTIVE RESOURCES AND SCHOLARSHIPS FOR 24 STUDENTS. 5) PREPARE THE CURRENT AND FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY RESPONSE THROUGH COURSEWORK AND FIELD EXPERIENCES FOR MPH AND BS STUDENTS AND FORMAL TRAINING IN CONTACT TRACING, EMERGENCY OPERATIONS, AND OUTBREAK INVESTIGATION FOR 34 MPH STUDENTS.   WITHIN THE THREE-YEAR GRANT PERIOD, SHU WILL PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO 31 PIOSCHOLARS (24 BACHELOR’S TRAINED PUBLIC HEALTH WORKERS AND SEVEN STUDENTS CURRENTLY COMPLETING SHU’S MPH PROGRAM), 10 PIOHEALTH SCHOLARS (STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED IN SHU’S 4+1 BS-MPH PROGRAM), AND 14 PIOPATHWAY SCHOLARS (STUDENTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED IN SHU’S BACHELOR OF SCIENCE (BS) IN HEALTH SCIENCE PROGRAM). SHU PLANS FOR 31 HRSA PHSP-FUNDED SCHOLARS TO GRADUATE WITH AN MPH AND 24 TO GRADUATE WITH A BS DURING THE GRANT PERIOD.  ULTIMATELY, THIS PROJECT WILL INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM IN CONNECTICUT’S DIVISION OF EMERGENCY MANAGEMENT AND HOMELAND SECURITY (DEMHS) REGION 1, PARTICULARLY THE GREATER BRIDGEPORT AREA, TO MEET THE CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS AND 10 ESSENTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES. IT WILL ALSO ULTIMATELY DECREASE PUBLIC HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INCREASE HEALTH EQUITY IN CT DEMHS REGION 1/BRIDGEPORT AND INCREASE THE DIVERSITY OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE IN THE REGION.   SHU REQUESTS A FUNDING PREFERENCE FOR DEMONSTRATING BOTH OF THE FOLLOWING CRITERIA: (1) SERVING INDIVIDUALS FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS; AND (2) GRADUATING LARGE PROPORTIONS OF INDIVIDUALS WHO SERVE IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - ADDRESS: 683 HOES LANE WEST, PISCATAWAY, NJ, 08854 PROJECT DIRECTOR: LAURA LIANG CONTACT PHONE: 732-235-9700 EMAIL: HEMMINLB@SPH.RUTGERS.EDU  WEBSITE: SPH.RUTGERS.EDU GRANT PROGRAM FUNDS REQUESTED: $1,497,658  THE GOAL OF THE RUTGERS SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM IS TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEMS TO MEET THE CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS, THE TEN ESSENTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES, AND DECREASE PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES. NEW JERSEY IS ONE OF THE MOST DENSELY POPULATED STATES IN THE NATION AND ONE OF THE MOST RACIALLY AND ETHNICALLY DIVERSE. HOWEVER, THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE PER CAPITA IS AMONG THE SMALLEST AND THE WEALTH GAP IS AMONG THE LARGEST IN THE COUNTRY. A LARGE PROPORTION OF GOVERNMENTAL PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS DO NOT HAVE FORMAL TRAINING IN PUBLIC HEALTH. IN ADDITION, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC HAS EXACERBATED STRIKING HEALTH INEQUITIES ACROSS NEW JERSEY AND UNDERSCORED THE NEED FOR PROFESSIONALS WITH THE SKILLS AND TRAINING NECESSARY TO ADDRESS THESE ISSUES IN THE STATE. STRENGTHENING THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY INCENTIVIZING PUBLIC HEALTH TRAINING AND CAREERS IS FUNDAMENTAL FOR ACHIEVING HEALTH AND WELLBEING FOR ALL IN NEW JERSEY. PROGRAM OBJECTIVES ARE TO: 1) ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY DEVELOPING OR STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND LINKAGES TO IDENTIFY EMPLOYMENT NEEDS, TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES, AND TO FACILITATE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS’ EMPLOYMENT POST-TRAINING COMPLETION IN STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, INCLUDING STATE, LOCAL, TERRITORIAL, OR TRIBAL PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH-RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. 2) EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INCORPORATE PRINCIPLES OF SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH INTO PRACTICE. 3) EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID–19, AS WELL AS OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES, BY PROVIDING PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCE (PRACTICUM) OPPORTUNITIES PROPOSED ACTIVITIES INCLUDE RECEIVING INPUT FROM ACADEMIC AND COMMUNITY-BASED PARTNERS ON EDUCATIONAL AND SKILLS NEEDED FOR PUBLIC HEALTH WORKERS (THROUGH FOCUS GROUPS AND A COMMUNITY ADVISORY BOARD); THE RECRUITMENT AND RETENTION OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS; THE PLACEMENT OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS IN APPLIED PRACTICE EXPERIENCES (FIELD EXPERIENCES); THE CREATION OF EIGHT SKILLS-BASED TRAINING COURSES TO AUGMENT OUR ACADEMIC PROGRAMS AND POST-EMPLOYMENT TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES; AND SPONSORING JOB FAIRS AND CAREER PANELS ANNUALLY TO FACILITATE EMPLOYMENT OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS POST-TRAINING IN STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENTS AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH-RELATED ORGANIZATIONS.  THROUGH THIS PROGRAM, 86 TRAINEES WILL BE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS (28 IN YEAR 1, 29 IN YEAR 2, AND 29 IN YEAR 3) TO PURSUE AN MPH OR A POPULATION HEALTH CERTIFICATE AT THE RUTGERS SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH. FIFTY-PERCENT (50%) OF THESE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS WILL BE FROM STATE AND LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENTS AND PROGRAMS AND 50% OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS WILL BE FROM UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS. THE RUTGERS SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH INTERDISCIPLINARY TEAM WITH EXPERTISE IN PUBLIC HEALTH EDUCATION, EPIDEMIOLOGY, MEDICINE, PROGRAM EVALUATION, WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT, HEALTH INEQUITIES, COVID-19 RESPONSE, AND CRITICAL ADMINISTRATIVE EXPERIENCE IN HIGHER EDUCATION WILL ALLOW FOR THE SUCCESSFUL EXECUTION OF THE PROGRAM. OUR PROGRAM QUALIFIES FOR FUNDING PREFERENCE BASED ON SERVING STUDENTS WHO ARE FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS (35% UNDERREPRESENTED RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITIES) AND GRADUATING A LARGE PROPORTION (21%) OF INDIVIDUALS WHO SERVE IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - THE UNIVERSITY AT ALBANY SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH REQUESTS A FUNDING PREFERENCE FOR THIS APPLICATION. THE UNIVERSITY AT ALBANY STRENGTHENING THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM (SPHWSP) WILL ENHANCE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY RECRUITING AND SUPPORTING DIVERSE GRADUATE STUDENT TRAINEES IN ITS MASTER OF PUBLIC HEALTH (MPH) PROGRAM AND BY PREPARING TRAINEES TO ADDRESS HEALTH DISPARITIES AND SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH THROUGH EITHER A HEALTH DISPARITIES OR MATERNAL AND CHILD HEALTH (MCH) GRADUATE CERTIFICATE. TRAINEES WILL COMPLETE FIELD EXPERIENCES TO GAIN EXPERIENCE WITH COVID-19 RECOVERY EFFORTS, PREPARATION FOR FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES, AND/OR HEALTH INEQUITIES AND SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH. THIS TRAINING WILL FACILITATE TRAINEES’ ENTRY INTO OR ADVANCEMENT IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE.  THE PROJECT’S OBJECTIVES AND SUB-OBJECTIVES ARE: OBJ. 1) ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND LINKAGES TO IDENTIFY EMPLOYMENT NEEDS, RECRUIT TRAINEES, IDENTIFY TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES, AND FACILITATE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS’ EMPLOYMENT POST-TRAINING COMPLETION IN STATE OR LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENTS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS. SUB-OBJECTIVES: BY THE END OF THE FIRST QUARTER OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, ESTABLISH A PROGRAM ADVISORY BOARD TO ADVISE PROGRAM ON EMPLOYMENT NEEDS, TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES AND EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITIES, AND HOLD QUARTERLY MEETINGS OF THIS BOARD THROUGHOUT THE ENTIRE PROJECT PERIOD; ENROLL AT LEAST 15 MPH STUDENTS INTO THE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM EACH GRANT YEAR; IN EACH PROJECT YEAR, AT LEAST 10 SEMINARS WILL BE HELD FOR TRAINEES ON TOPICS RELATED TO COVID-19, WORKFORCE NEEDS, AND CAREER DEVELOPMENT; IN EACH PROJECT YEAR, AT LEAST 80% OF TRAINEES WILL OBTAIN EMPLOYMENT IN A STATE OR LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENT OR COMMUNITY-BASED PUBLIC HEALTH ORGANIZATION WITHIN THREE MONTHS OF GRADUATION; BY THE END OF THE PROJECT PERIOD, ACQUIRE FUNDING TO S USTAIN SPHWSP. OBJ. 2) EDUCATE A DIVERSE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INCORPORATE PRINCIPLES OF SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH) INTO PRACTICE. SUB-OBJECTIVES: FOR EACH PROJECT YEAR, THERE WILL BE A 10% INCREASE IN TRAINEES FROM UNDERREPRESENTED GROUPS/UNDERSERVED POPULATIONS; IN EACH GRANT YEAR, ALL TRAINEES WILL ENROLL IN EITHER THE HEALTH DISPARITIES OR THE MATERNAL AND CHILD HEALTH GRADUATE CERTIFICATE IN ADDITION TO THE MPH PROGRAM; IN EACH GRANT YEAR, AT LEAST 2 SEMINARS WILL BE HELD FOR TRAINEES THAT FOCUS ON THE USE OF CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE SERVICES. OBJ. 3) EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID–19, AS WELL AS OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES, BY PROVIDING PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCE OPPORTUNITIES IN STATE AND LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENTS AND COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATIONS. SUB-OBJECTIVES: IN EACH GRANT YEAR, 100% OF TRAINEES WILL COMPLETE 2 INTERNSHIP EXPERIENCES, INCLUDING ONE AT A STATE OR LOCAL HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND ONE AT A COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATION; IN EACH GRANT YEAR, IDENTIFY AT LEAST 5 NEW INTERNSHIP PLACEMENT SITES.  TO ACCOMPLISH THESE OBJECTIVES, THE PROJECT TEAM WILL RECRUIT CURRENT PUBLIC HEALTH UNDERGRADUATE STUDENTS AND MEMBERS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE, WITH AN EMPHASIS ON RACE AND ETHNIC DIVERSITY, FIRST-GENERATION COLLEGE STATUS, AND RURAL RESIDENCE. TRAINEES WILL BE GIVEN FULL TUITION AND FEES SCHOLARSHIP SUPPORT FOR THEIR MPH PROGRAM AND EITHER A HEALTH DISPARITIES OR MCH GRADUATE CERTIFICATE, AND THEY WILL COMPLETE A FIELD PLACEMENT IN A HEALTH DEPARTMENT AND A COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATION. TRAINEES WILL PARTICIPATE IN A SEMINAR SERIES TO ADDRESS WORKFORCE TRAINING NEEDS, AND THEY WILL RECEIVE CAREER SERVICES TO FACILITATE THEIR ENTRY INTO OR ADVANCEMENT IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE. PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - FUNDING PREFERENCE: UNDERREPRESENTED RACIAL AND ETHNIC MINORITIES (URM)  BRIEF PROJECT OVERVIEW: THE DOWNSTATE PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM (DPHSP) WILL RECRUIT, TRAIN, AND RETAIN URM PUBLIC HEALTH STUDENTS TO DELIVER CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT CARE AND WORK TO REDUCE DISPARITIES WHILE PROMOTING HEALTH EQUITY. THE PI, DR. ANIKA DANIELS-OSAZE HAS OVER TWO (2) DECADES OF EXPERIENCE MANAGING HRSA FUNDED PROGRAMS AT DOWNSTATE, THE ONLY MEDICAL SCHOOL IN BROOKLYN, NEW YORK CITY WITH A POPULATION OF 2.3 MILLION. THE TARGET GEOGRAPHIC POPULATIONS ARE NORTH AND CENTRAL, BROOKLYN WHERE 47% OF RESIDENTS ARE BLACK AND LATINX, THE RATES OF POVERTY, UNEMPLOYMENT, AND FOOD INSECURITY ARE HIGHER AND LIFE EXPECTANCY IS LOWER. PRIORITY AREAS FOR THE DPHSP ARE INCREASING THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE, PROVIDING EDUCATION ON SDOH, DISPARITIES, AND HEALTH EQUITY, AND PROVIDING SKILLS TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR AND RESPOND TO COVID-19 AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS. THE CO-PI, DR. CAMACHO-RIVERA HAS EXTENSIVE EXPERIENCE IN RECRUITING, TRAINING, AND MENTORING GRADUATE STUDENTS, FROM URM BACKGROUNDS AND HISTORICALLY EXCLUDED COMMUNITIES AND WILL USE THESE SKILLS TO DEVELOP A QUALIFIED AND DIVERSE GROUP OF TRAINEES FOR THE PROGRAM. MS. HUSSAIN, THE APEX COORDINATOR WILL ASSIST IN EXPANDING OUR FIELD PLACEMENTS FOR ALL TRAINEES OVER THE THREE-YEAR PROGRAM PERIOD.   PROGRAM OBJECTIVES: THE DPHSP WILL: 1) DIVERSIFY THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE; 2) DEVELOP AN INTERDISCIPLINARY AND HEALTH EQUITY FOCUSED PUBLIC HEALTH SEMINAR SERIES; 3) LAUNCH AN EQUITY-CENTERED STUDENT-TAILORED MENTORING PROGRAM, CALLED PROGRESS; 4) INCREASE THE CAPACITY OF PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEMS THROUGH COVID-19 AND HEALTH EQUITY APEX OPPORTUNITIES AND DOWNSTATE-WIDE ACTIVITIES. IN ORDER TO ACCOMPLISH THESE OBJECTIVES, WE WILL EXPAND STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIPS BEYOND THE CURRENT AGENCIES WHICH INCLUDE THE NEW YORK STATE AND CITY HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, THE ARTHUR ASHE INSTITUTE FOR URBAN  HEALTH (COMMUNITY-BASED ORGANIZATION), THE BROOKLYN HEALTH DISPARITIES CENTER (BHDC), THE UNIVERSITY HOSPITAL OF BROOKLYN (UHB), KINGS COUNTY HOSPITAL CENTER (KCHC) AND INSTITUTIONS OF HIGHER EDUCATION TO PROVIDE FIELD PLACEMENT SITES FOR 85 TRAINEES PER YEAR.   ACTIVITIES: WE WILL LEVERAGE THESE PARTNERSHIPS TO CREATE FULL-TIME PUBLIC HEALTH POSITIONS FOR GRADUATES OF OUR TRAINING PROGRAM. OUR PLAN IS TO HELP TO DIVERSIFY THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE THROUGH RECRUITMENT AND TRAINING OF MPH, DRPH, AND MD-MPH STUDENTS FROM UNDERREPRESENTED AND HISTORICALLY EXCLUDED BACKGROUNDS BY ENHANCING ACADEMIC PERFORMANCE AND CAREER OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH MENTORING INITIATIVES. WE WILL ALSO PROVIDE PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT SEMINARS FOR TRAINEES FOCUSED ON CAREER DEVELOPMENT, COVID-19 AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCY PREPAREDNESS STRATEGIES AND EDUCATION RELATED TO SDOH, DISPARITIES, AND HEALTH EQUITY. THROUGH DPHSP, WE WILL PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO OFFSET THE FINANCIAL BURDEN FACED BY URM AND DISADVANTAGED TRAINEES.   EVALUATION: AN EVALUATION PLAN HAS BEEN DEVELOPED USING A PLAN-DO-STUDY-ACT (PDSA) MODEL THAT WILL HELP US TO ASSESS ALL LEVELS OF THE TRAINING PROGRAM. PROJECT OUTCOMES WILL BE MEASURED BY RECRUITMENT, RETENTION, GRADUATION RATES AND JOB PLACEMENT DATA.  BOTH QUANTITATIVE AND QUALITATIVE ASSESSMENTS WILL BE USED IN REVIEWING THE PROGRAM OBJECTIVES AND OUTPUTS.   IMPACT: IN 3 YEARS, WE WILL TRAIN AND PROVIDE FIELD PLACEMENTS FOR 255 STUDENTS WHILE FACILITATING ENTRY INTO A FULL-TIME PUBLIC HEALTH POSITION UPON GRADUATION.

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - PROJECT DIRECTOR NAME: ELIZABETH WATTENBERG, PH.D. ADDRESS: DIVISION OF ENVIRONMENTAL HEALTH SCIENCES SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH ROOM 1110 MAYO 420 DELAWARE STREET SE MINNEAPOLIS, MN 55455-0341 CONTACT PHONE NUMBERS: 612-626-0184 (VOICE); 612-626-0650 (FAX) EMAIL ADDRESS: WATTE004@UMN.EDU TOTAL GRANT FUNDS REQUESTED: $1,500,000.00 WE ARE REQUESTING A PREFERENCE FOR FUNDING BASED ON TWO AREAS: SPH SERVES INDIVIDUALS WHO ARE FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS, AND SPH GRADUATES LARGE PROPORTIONS OF INDIVIDUALS WHO SERVE IN UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES.  THE PURPOSE OF THE PROPOSED SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM IS TO STRENGTHEN THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY PROVIDING SCHOLARSHIPS FOR INDIVIDUALS TO PURSUE A MASTERS OF PUBLIC HEALTH (MPH) AT THE UNIVERSITY OF MINNESOTA SCHOOL OF PUBLIC HEALTH (SPH), AND TO FACILITATE THE TRANSITION OF SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS (TRAINEES) TO A CAREER IN PUBLIC HEALTH AFTER COMPLETION OF THEIR TRAINING. THE PROPOSED SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM IS FRAMED BY THE NEED TO ADDRESS PERSISTENT HEALTH DISPARITIES IN MINNESOTA, AND BY LOCAL PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE SHORTAGES. THE FOUNDATION OF THE PROPOSED PROGRAM IS A WELL-ESTABLISHED PARTNERSHIP BETWEEN SPH AND THE MINNESOTA DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH (MDH). THE OBJECTIVES OF THE PROPOSED PROGRAM ARE AS FOLLOWS:  OBJECTIVE 1. ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY RECRUITING TRAINEES TO THE SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM.  OBJECTIVE 2. PROVIDE A CURRICULUM TO TRAINEES THAT WILL ENHANCE THEIR KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS IN THE AREA OF PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES, AND PREPARE THEM TO INCORPORATE THE PRINCIPLES OF SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH INTO PRACTICE.  OBJECTIVE 3. PROVIDE PUBLIC HEALTH PRACTICE EXPERIENCE FOR TRAINEES TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID-19, AS WELL AS OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES BY PLACING THEM IN FIELD EXPERIENCES IN GOVERNMENTAL PUBLIC HEALTH OR OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS.  OBJECTIVE 4. FACILITATE TRAINEE EMP LOYMENT, POST-TRAINING COMPLETION, IN GOVERNMENTAL PUBLIC HEALTH OR OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH-RELATED ORGANIZATIONS.   THE PROPOSED PROGRAM WILL BE LED BY THE SPH ASSOCIATE DEAN OF EDUCATION AND STUDENT ENGAGEMENT. UNDER HER LEADERSHIP, THE PROGRAM WILL BE IMPLEMENTED BY SKILLED SPH STUDENT SERVICES STAFF, WHO WILL COORDINATE THE FOLLOWING: THE SELECTION OF TRAINEES AND AWARDING OF SCHOLARSHIPS; THE ORIENTATION OF THE TRAINEES TO THE CURRICULUM; THE PLACEMENT OF TRAINEES IN FIELD EXPERIENCES; AND FACILITATION OF THE TRANSITION OF THE TRAINEES TO CAREERS IN PUBLIC HEALTH. THE SKILLED STAFF WILL ALSO CONDUCT AND COORDINATE THE EVALUATION AND CONTINUOUS IMPROVEMENT OF THE PROGRAM. SPH FACULTY ADVISORS WILL PROVIDE ACADEMIC SUPPORT AND GUIDANCE. WE WILL WORK WITH OUR MDH PARTNERS TO ENSURE THAT THE CURRICULUM PREPARES THE TRAINEES TO ENTER THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE EQUIPPED TO IDENTIFY AND ANALYZE HEALTH DISPARITIES, ENGAGE THE COMMUNITIES THEY SERVE, AND IMPLEMENT EVIDENCE-BASED STRATEGIES THAT WILL HAVE A POSITIVE AND MEANINGFUL EFFECT ON HEALTH EQUITY. UNDERSTANDING HEALTH DISPARITIES IS KEY TO DEVELOPING THE SKILLS NECESSARY TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID-19, AS WELL AS OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES. THE TRAINEES WILL BE RECRUITED FROM THE 8 MPH PROGRAMS OFFERED BY SPH. WE ANTICIPATE THAT 15 TRAINEES WILL BE AWARDED SCHOLARSHIPS EACH YEAR, STARTING IN FALL 2022. THE INNOVATIVE COMPONENTS OF THE PROPOSED PROGRAM INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING: 1) STUDENTS WILL COMPLETE A MINOR IN HEALTH EQUITY. 2) WE WILL COLLABORATE WITH OUR MDH PARTNERS TO DEVELOP A SEMINAR SERIES, WHICH STUDENTS WILL ATTEND, ON THE USE OF CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE STRATEGIES TO AUTHENTICALLY ENGAGE COMMUNITY MEMBERS. 3) SPH HAS AN OUTSTANDING FORMAL MENTOR PROGRAM THAT CONNECTS CURRENTLY ENROLLED SPH STUDENTS TO PROFESSIONALS TO HELP WITH CAREER DISCERNMENT, NETWORKING, AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT.

THE APPLICANT MET QUALIFICATION #1 IN THE AREAS OF EDUCATIONAL/ENVIRONMENTAL DISADVANTAGED, ECONOMICALLY DISADVANTAGED, AND UNDERREPRESENTED RACIAL/ETHNIC MINORITIES. OAKLAND UNIVERSITY'S (OU) MASTER OF PUBLIC HEALTH (MPH) PROGRAM AIMS TO INCREASE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE CAPACITY AND PREPARE FUTURE PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS TO DIMINISH HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INEQUITIES EXPERIENCED BY COMMUNITIES. TO ACHIEVE THIS AIM, OU'S MPH PROGRAM, ACCREDITED BY THE COUNCIL ON EDUCATION FOR PUBLIC HEALTH, HAS DEVISED THE PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP (PHS) PROGRAM. THE PHS PROGRAM HAS THE FOLLOWING SIX OBJECTIVES:  OBJECTIVE 1: ESTABLISH THE PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP TEAM BY OCTOBER 31, 2022, TO ASSIST IN IMPLEMENTING AND EVALUATING THE PHS PROGRAM. THIS WILL INVOLVE HIRING AN MPH TRAINEE TO BECOME THE PHS GRADUATE RESEARCH ASSISTANT (GRA).  OBJECTIVE 2: RECRUIT 27 STUDENTS TO THE MASTER OF PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAM FROM DISADVANTAGED BACKGROUNDS WHO ARE COMMITTED TO WORKING IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD STARTING FALL 2022. THE PROJECT DIRECTOR AND THE PHS GRA WILL IMPLEMENT A SIX-PRONG MARKETING STRATEGY AND COLLABORATE WITH INTERNAL OU SECTORS AND COMMUNITY SECTORS TO RECRUIT DISADVANTAGED STUDENTS TO THE PHS PROGRAM. EXISTING SUPPORT SERVICES WILL BE FURTHER INTEGRATED TO FACILITATE BELONGING, STUDENT SUCCESS, AND CAREER ADVISING TO RETAIN PHS RECIPIENTS. EACH RECIPIENT WILL BE MATCHE D WITH AN OU MPH ALUMNUS TO FURTHER SUPPORT PHS RECIPIENTS' SUCCESSFUL MATRICULATION THROUGH THE MPH PROGRAM AND EXPAND THEIR PROFESSIONAL NETWORK.  OBJECTIVE 3: INCREASE THE NUMBER OF MPH COURSES AND COMPETENCY-RELATED EVENTS THAT IMPROVE THE EDUCATION AND PREPARATION OF MPH STUDENTS TO ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES TO 47% (28% INCREASE) BY SEPTEMBER 1, 2022. MPH FACULTY WILL MODIFY THE MPH CURRICULUM TO INCORPORATE ADDITIONAL DIDACT TEACHING AND COURSE ASSESSMENT THAT EVALUATES STUDENTS' APPLICATION OF HEALTH DISPARITIES AND HEALTH INEQUITY COMPETENCIES.  OBJECTIVE 4: INCREASE THE NUMBER OF PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCES (PRACTICUM) THAT OCCUR IN A MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREA (MUA) BY APRIL 28, 2023. PHS RECIPIENTS WILL BE CONNECTED TO PRACTICUM SITES IN MUA BY INVITING ALL SITES TO ATTEND THE ANNUAL PRACTICUM NETWORKING EVENT.  OBJECTIVE 5: SUPPORT 100% OF PHS RECIPIENTS IN GAINING EMPLOYMENT IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD AT AN MUA ORGANIZATION SIX MONTHS POST-GRADUATION. AIDING PHS RECIPIENTS GAINING EMPLOYMENT IN AN MUA ORGANIZATION IS A CRITICAL COMPONENT; THEREFORE, MULTIPLE ACTIVITIES WILL BE PERFORMED, INCLUDING ANNUAL CAREER DEVELOPMENT EVENTS, CREATING EPORTFOLIOS, CONNECTING RECIPIENTS TO JOB OPPORTUNITIES, AND HOSTING A NETWORKING EVENT.  OBJECTIVE 6: DISSEMINATE PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM OUTCOMES TO OU LEADERSHIP AND THE MICHIGAN AND SCHOLARLY COMMUNITIES STARTING SUMMER 2023. PROJECT OUTCOMES WILL BE DISSEMINATED THROUGH MEETINGS, NEWSLETTERS, AND SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS.   THE STUDENT TARGET AUDIENCE OF THE PHS PROGRAM IS DISADVANTAGED (1) UNDERREPRESENTED RACIAL/ETHNIC MINORITIES, (2) TRADITIONAL STUDENT LEARNERS, AND (3) ADULT LEARNERS WHO CURRENTLY WORK IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD. THE PHS PROGRAM WILL FUND 27 DISADVANTAGED MPH TRAINEES.

PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - ADDRESS: 126 PARK AVENUE, BRIDGEPORT, CT 06604 PROJECT DIRECTOR NAME: MEREDITH GAFFNEY, MPH CONTACT PHONE NUMBER: 203-576-4111 EMAIL ADDRESS: MGAFFNEY@BRIDGEPORT.EDU WEBSITE ADDRESS: HTTPS://WWW.BRIDGEPORT.EDU/ACADEMICS/PROGRAMS/PUBLIC-HEALTH-MPH/ FUNDS REQUESTED: $1,500,000 FUNDING PREFERENCE REQUESTED: YES  THE MASTER’S OF PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAM, UNDER THE UNIVERSITY OF BRIDGEPORT’S COLLEGE OF HEALTH SCIENCES PROPOSES THE SCHOLARS PROJECT (STUDENTS CREATING HEALTHIER OUTCOMES IN LOCAL AREAS AND REGIONS) WHICH SEEKS TO INCREASE THE CAPACITY IN PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEMS BY INCREASING THE NUMBER OF DIVERSE, CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY COMPETENT PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS IN THE STATE OF CONNECTICUT AND THE NATION.  THE MPH ONLINE CURRICULUM OCCUPIES SIX SEVEN-WEEK TERMS PER YEAR AND CONSISTS OF 42 SEMESTER CREDIT HOURS: 33 CORE CREDITS AND 9 CONCENTRATION CREDITS.  THE FINAL COMPONENT INCLUDES A PRACTICUM, COMPLETED AT A PUBLIC HEALTH ORGANIZATION. PARTNERSHIPS WITH DEPARTMENTS OF HEALTH AND COMMUNITY-BASED HEALTH ORGANIZATIONS ARE VITAL TO PROVIDING THIS FIELD EXPERIENCE.  GRADUATES ARE OFTEN ABLE TO TRANSITION INTO EMPLOYMENT IN THE SAME ORGANIZATIONS WHERE THEY COMPLETED THEIR PRACTICA.  THUS, THEY ARE ABLE TO HELP FILL EMPLOYMENT NEEDS IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH SECTOR.  MOTIVATIONAL INTERVIEWING CURRICULUM, LEADERSHIP DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOPS, AND DATA TO POLICY WORKSHOPS WILL BE ADDED TO MPH CURRICULUM TO ENHANCE STUDENTS’ ABILITY TO APPLY ACADEMIC CONCEPTS TO REAL-WORLD PUBLIC HEALTH SCENARIOS.   OBJECTIVES FOR THE SCHOLARS PROJECT OVER THE PROJECT PERIOD (9/30/2022-9/29/2025) ARE:  -	ENHANCE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS TO IDENTIFY EMPLOYMENT NEEDS, TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES, FACILITATE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS’ EMPLOYMENT POST-TRAINING COMPLETION IN STATE/LOCAL GOVERNMENTS. -	EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INCORPORATE PRINCIPLES  OF SDOH INTO PRACTICE -	EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID-19 AS WELL AS OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES BY PROVIDING FIELD EXPERIENCE BASED ON SPRING 2022 DATA, THE MAJORITY OF UB’S 169 MPH STUDENTS (80%) ARE FROM THE TRI-STATE AREA (CT, NY, AND NJ).  NEARLY TWO-THIRDS (60%) IDENTIFY AS PEOPLE OF COLOR, 42% AS BLACK/NON-HISPANIC, 14% AS HISPANIC/LATINX. 4% AS ASIAN/PACIFIC ISLANDER.  A TOTAL OF 46% OF STUDENTS ARE UNDER 30 YEARS OLD, WITH THE AVERAGE STUDENT AGE BEING 34 YEARS OLD.  EIGHTY-THREE PERCENT (83%) OF STUDENTS SELF-IDENTIFY AS FEMALE, AND 16% IDENTIFY AS MALE. MOST MPH STUDENTS ALREADY WORK IN THE PUBLIC HEALTH SECTOR AND ENROLL IN THE MPH PROGRAM TO FURTHER THEIR CREDENTIALS TO ATTAIN MORE LEADERSHIP POSITIONS.   NATIONALLY, THE COVID-19 PANDEMIC IS REVEALING A HISTORIC UNDERINVESTMENT IN THE COUNTRY’S PUBLIC HEALTH INFRASTRUCTURE.  TO REBUILD THE COUNTRY’S PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEM, HEALTH DEPARTMENTS AT BOTH STATE AND LOCAL LEVELS MUST HIRE AT LEAST 80,000 MORE FULL-TIME EQUIVALENT POSITIONS (AN INCREASE OF APPROXIMATELY 80%) [5]. THIS DAUNTING NUMBER OF NEW PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS REQUIRES PRIORITIZING PUBLIC HEALTH EDUCATION WITH SPECIFIC ATTENTION TO CULTURALLY AND LINGUISTICALLY APPROPRIATE SERVICES (CLAS).  FACTORS THAT PREVENT PEOPLE IN THE GREATEST NEED OF HEALTHCARE FROM ACCESSING IT INCLUDE A LACK OF HIGH-QUALITY HEALTHCARE, PERCEIVED DISCRIMINATION DURING CLINICAL ENCOUNTERS, AND DIFFICULTY ACCESSING CULTURALLY COMPETENT CARE [6].   SCHOLARSHIPS WILL BE PROVIDED TO FORTY STUDENTS PER YEAR IN THE UNIVERSITY OF BRIDGEPORT’S MASTER OF PUBLIC HEALTH (MPH) PROGRAM WHO EXHIBIT FINANCIAL NEED AND ACADEMIC EXCELLENCE DURING EACH YEAR OF THE PROJECT.  IN TOTAL, SCHOLARSHIPS WILL BE AWARDED TO 120 STUDENTS. PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIP PROGRAM - PUBLIC HEALTH SCHOLARSHIPS THE MEDICAL COLLEGE OF WISCONSIN 8701 WATERTOWN PLANK ROAD, MILWAUKEE, WI 53226 DAVID A. NELSON, PHD, MS, PROGRAM DIRECTOR 414-955-4386 (PHONE) DANELSON@MCW.EDU PROJECT PERIOD: 09/30/2022 – 09/29/2025  ABSTRACT THE LONG-STANDING PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS AT THE MEDICAL COLLEGE OF WISCONSIN (MCW) SEEKS TO SUPPORT 19 SCHOLARSHIPS PER YEAR TO MEET THE CURRENT SHORTAGE OF PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS AT ALL LEVELS OF TRAINING. MCW IS AN IDEAL TRAINING GROUND FOR THESE PUBLIC HEALTH PROFESSIONALS SEEKING GRADUATE LEVEL TRAINING IN PUBLIC HEALTH. MCW IS SITUATED IN A DIVERSE URBAN ENVIRONMENT. INCREASING THE PROGRAM’S CAPACITY TO PROVIDE SCHOLARSHIPS TO STUDENTS WITHIN GROUPS TRADITIONALLY UNDERREPRESENTED IN PUBLIC HEALTH WILL EXPAND THE PROGRAM’S COMMITMENT TO PREPARING A DIVERSIFIED TALENT POOL OF PROFESSIONALS TO MEET CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS. THROUGH TRAINING, THE STUDENTS WILL INCREASE THE CAPACITY IN PUBLIC HEALTH SYSTEMS TO MEET CORE PUBLIC HEALTH FUNCTIONS, THE TEN ESSENTIAL PUBLIC HEALTH SERVICES, AND DECREASE PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES.  PROGRAM OBJECTIVES  1.	ENHANCE THE KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS OF THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE BY DEVELOPING AND STRENGTHENING COMMUNITY PARTNERSHIPS AND LINKAGES TO IDENTIFY EMPLOYMENT NEEDS AND TRAINING OPPORTUNITIES AND TO FACILITATE SCHOLARSHIP RECIPIENTS' EMPLOYMENT POST-TRAINING COMPLETION IN STATE OR LOCAL GOVERNMENTS, INCLUDING STATE, LOCAL, TERRITORIAL OR TRIBAL PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENTS, AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH-RELATED ORGANIZATIONS. 2.	EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO ADDRESS PUBLIC HEALTH INEQUITIES AND HEALTH DISPARITIES AND INCORPORATE SOCIAL DETERMINANTS OF HEALTH (SDOH) PRINCIPLES INTO PRACTICE. 3.	EDUCATE THE PUBLIC HEALTH WORKFORCE TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID–19 AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES BY PROVIDING PUBLIC HEALTH FIELD EXPERIENCE (PRACTICUM) OPPORTUNITIES.  THE MEDICAL COLLEGE OF WISCONSIN HAS HAD AN EXISTING PUBLIC HEALTH TRAINING PROGRAM AT THE MASTER'S LEVEL SINCE 1987. THE MEDICAL COLLEGE OF WISCONSIN PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS SERVES BOTH UNDERREPRESENTED BY RACIAL AND ETHNIC IDENTITIES AND GRADUATING STUDENTS WHO SERVE IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS. TWENTY-ONE (21%) OF OUR STUDENTS ARE UNDERREPRESENTED IN PUBLIC HEALTH AND 33% OF OUR STUDENTS SERVE IN MEDICALLY UNDERSERVED AREAS. OUR PUBLIC HEALTH PROGRAMS ENCOMPASS THE RANGE OF GRADUATE TRAINING AND INCLUDES A MASTER’S DEGREE IN PUBLIC HEALTH (MPH), DOCTOR OF PUBLIC HEALTH (DRPH) AND A DOCTORATE IN PUBLIC AND COMMUNITY HEALTH (PHD).  THE MEDICAL COLLEGE OF WISCONSIN STRIVES TO BE A PLACE WHERE DIVERSITY IS CELEBRATED AND EMBRACED. THE SENIOR LEADERSHIP OF MCW UNDER PRESIDENT JOHN RAYMOND, MD AND DEAN AND PROVOST JOSEPH KERSCHNER, MD AND THE DEAN OF THE GRADUATE SCHOOL, RAVI MISRA, PHD SUPPORT PROGRAMS AND IDEALS THAT ALIGN WITH THE U.S. DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES OFFICE OF MINORITY HEALTH PROGRAM “THINK CULTURAL HEALTH” WITH OUR PROGRAMS LIKE PROFESSIONALISM WEEK AND “WEWILL” AND “MCWILL” THAT ARE DEVOTED TO OVERCOMING RACISM AND SEXISM IN OUR INSTITUTION. THE EXPANDED ENROLLMENT WILL YIELD PUBLIC HEALTH GRADUATES PREPARED TO WORK IN GOVERNMENTAL PUBLIC HEALTH DEPARTMENTS OR OTHER POSITIONS AS MAY BE REQUIRED TO PREVENT, PREPARE FOR, AND RESPOND TO RECOVERY ACTIVITIES RELATED TO COVID-19 AND OTHER PUBLIC HEALTH EMERGENCIES. FROM THE GENERALIST BSPH TO THE FIVE PROGRAM OPTIONS OF THE MPH, GRADUATION RATES EXCEED 90% IN ALL PROGRAMS AND 100% FOR SCHOLARSHIP STUDENTS. ALL DEGREE PROGRAMS REQUIRE PRACTICE PLACEMENTS. THE INDIVIDUALIZED CAREER SERVICES THROUGH ACADEMIC AFFAIRS AIDS STUDENTS IN SECURING JOBS UPON GRADUATION.
